heading: Today
text: Variable clouds through Quebec.  Elsewhere, mostly cloudy, with rain likely south of Rt. 2 west to Saranac Lake, decreasing this afternoon. Scattered showers north, spotty near the Quebec border.  Damp and cool.  Highs 50 to 55 south, to around 60 in Quebec.  Winds east to southeast 10 to 15 mph, gusting 20 to 30 mph.

heading: Tonight
text: Mostly cloudy, with scattered showers, more likely south and east, diminishing.  Lows in the low to mid 40s.  Winds east to southeast 10 to 15 mph, gusting up to 25 mph this evening, diminishing overnight.

heading: Tuesday
text: Morning clouds breaking for some sun from the Adirondacks and Rt. 2 north.  A few passing showers, mostly from the Green Mountains east, and south of Rt. 4.  Highs in the upper 50s to low 60s.  Winds variable to north less than 10 mph.
